Description: Body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice or Type B1 kantharos; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black with part of lotus flower in added white outline; two faded white bands below; exterior reserved; inscription on exterior.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Temple of Aphrodite (Naukratis), Context Φ5
Curator's comments: The size of the sherd, the lack of diagnostic elements and the absence of decoration on the interior and exterior surfaces make it impossible to determine whether it came from a kantharos or a chalice. Simple Animal Style chalices (including patterned chalices) have little decoration on their interior and exterior. Given the size of the sherd, it may come from an undecorated part of the chalice. Kantharoi Type B (See Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983, 169) have very little decoration as well. Kantharoi Type B1 have lotus flowers and lotus buds above two white bands on the interior (Williams 1983, 169). Many kantharoi Type B have painted inscriptions beneath the rim, and they have been found on Aegina as well as at Naukratis. The number '18' and 'Φ5' are written on the exterior surface of the sherd. '18' is written on a label on the interior.
Bibliographic references: Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (p. 63, no. 735, pl. XXI, no. 735)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 679, no. 386)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1503) (phase 2)
